title: Pipeline UX: add --dry-run and clarify output directory behavior
body:
Synopsis: Add a safe dry-run mode for demos and make output directory behavior consistent across scripts/docs.

## Background
In workshops, we often want to run PM/Dev/QA to generate a result without writing any Dev-proposed files or moving watcher files. Also, output directory examples should behave consistently.

## Requirements
- Add a '--dry-run' option for run_once:
  - run PM/Dev/QA as normal
  - do not write Dev files (even if --write-files is set)
  - still write the result JSON to outgoing/ (or print to stdout; choose one and document it)
- Ensure '--output-dir' is always respected and documented consistently across scripts and README.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] --dry-run produces a result JSON but does not write Dev-proposed code files.
- [ ] --output-dir changes where the result JSON is written.
- [ ] Scripts and docs show accurate examples.

## Where to look
- src/agent_mvp/pipeline/run_once.py (CLI flags and save_result behavior)
- scripts/run_once.ps1 and scripts/run_once.sh (examples)
- README.md (usage docs)
